trans-unit.source: Deploy a web app that is linked to a GitHub repository
trans-unit.target: Deploy a web app that is linked to a GitHub repository

trans-unit.source: Use an Azure Resource Manager template to deploy a web app that contains a project from a GitHub repository.
trans-unit.target: Use an Azure Resource Manager template to deploy a web app that contains a project from a GitHub repository.

trans-unit.source: Deploy a web app linked to a GitHub repository
trans-unit.target: Deploy a web app linked to a GitHub repository

trans-unit.source: In this topic, you will learn how to create an Azure Resource Manager template that deploys a web app that is linked to a project in a GitHub repository.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, you will learn how to create an Azure Resource Manager template that deploys a web app that is linked to a project in a GitHub repository.

trans-unit.source: You will learn how to define which resources are deployed and
trans-unit.target: You will learn how to define which resources are deployed and

trans-unit.source: how to define parameters that are specified when the deployment is executed.
trans-unit.target: how to define parameters that are specified when the deployment is executed.

trans-unit.source: You can use this template for your own deployments, or customize it to meet your requirements.
trans-unit.target: You can use this template for your own deployments, or customize it to meet your requirements.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating templates, see [Authoring Azure Resource Manager Templates](../resource-group-authoring-templates.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating templates, see [Authoring Azure Resource Manager Templates](../resource-group-authoring-templates.md).

trans-unit.source: For the complete template, see [Web App Linked to GitHub template](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/blob/master/201-web-app-github-deploy/azuredeploy.json).
trans-unit.target: For the complete template, see [Web App Linked to GitHub template](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/blob/master/201-web-app-github-deploy/azuredeploy.json).

trans-unit.source: What you will deploy
trans-unit.target: What you will deploy

trans-unit.source: With this template, you will deploy a web app that contains the code from a project in GitHub.
trans-unit.target: With this template, you will deploy a web app that contains the code from a project in GitHub.

trans-unit.source: To run the deployment automatically, click the following button:
trans-unit.target: To run the deployment automatically, click the following button:

trans-unit.source: eploy to Azure]
trans-unit.target: eploy to Azure]

trans-unit.source: Parameters
trans-unit.target: Parameters

trans-unit.source: repoURL
trans-unit.target: repoURL

trans-unit.source: The URL for GitHub repository that contains the project to deploy.
trans-unit.target: The URL for GitHub repository that contains the project to deploy.

trans-unit.source: This parameter contains a default value but this value is only intended to show you how to provide the URL for repository.
trans-unit.target: This parameter contains a default value but this value is only intended to show you how to provide the URL for repository.

trans-unit.source: You can use this value when testing the template but you will want to provide the URL your own repository when working with the template.
trans-unit.target: You can use this value when testing the template but you will want to provide the URL your own repository when working with the template.

trans-unit.source: branch
trans-unit.target: branch

trans-unit.source: The branch of the repository to use when deploying the application.
trans-unit.target: The branch of the repository to use when deploying the application.

trans-unit.source: The default value is master, but you can provide the name of any branch in the repository that you wish to deploy.
trans-unit.target: The default value is master, but you can provide the name of any branch in the repository that you wish to deploy.

trans-unit.source: Resources to deploy
trans-unit.target: Resources to deploy

trans-unit.source: Web app
trans-unit.target: Web app

trans-unit.source: Creates the web app that is linked to the project in GitHub.
trans-unit.target: Creates the web app that is linked to the project in GitHub.

trans-unit.source: You specify the name of the web app through the **siteName** parameter, and the location of the web app through the **siteLocation** parameter.
trans-unit.target: You specify the name of the web app through the **siteName** parameter, and the location of the web app through the **siteLocation** parameter.

trans-unit.source: In the **dependsOn** element, the template defines the web app
trans-unit.target: In the **dependsOn** element, the template defines the web app

trans-unit.source: as dependent on the service hosting plan.
trans-unit.target: as dependent on the service hosting plan.

trans-unit.source: Because it is dependent on the hosting plan, the web app is not created until the hosting plan has finished being created.
trans-unit.target: Because it is dependent on the hosting plan, the web app is not created until the hosting plan has finished being created.

trans-unit.source: The **dependsOn** element is only used to specify deployment
trans-unit.target: The **dependsOn** element is only used to specify deployment

trans-unit.source: order.
trans-unit.target: order.

trans-unit.source: If you do not mark the web app as dependent on the hosting plan, Azure Resource Mananger will attempt to create both resources at the same time and you may receive an error if the web app is created before the hosting
trans-unit.target: If you do not mark the web app as dependent on the hosting plan, Azure Resource Mananger will attempt to create both resources at the same time and you may receive an error if the web app is created before the hosting

trans-unit.source: plan.
trans-unit.target: plan.

trans-unit.source: The web app also has a child resource which is defined in **resources** section below.
trans-unit.target: The web app also has a child resource which is defined in **resources** section below.

trans-unit.source: This child resource defines source control for the project deployed with the web app.
trans-unit.target: This child resource defines source control for the project deployed with the web app.

trans-unit.source: In this template, the source control
trans-unit.target: In this template, the source control

trans-unit.source: is linked to a particular GitHub repository.
trans-unit.target: is linked to a particular GitHub repository.

trans-unit.source: The GitHub repository is defined with the code **"RepoUrl":"https://github.com/davidebbo-test/Mvc52Application.git"** You might hard-code the repository URL when you want to create a template that repeatedly deploys a single project while requiring the minimum number of parameters.
trans-unit.target: The GitHub repository is defined with the code **"RepoUrl":"https://github.com/davidebbo-test/Mvc52Application.git"** You might hard-code the repository URL when you want to create a template that repeatedly deploys a single project while requiring the minimum number of parameters.

trans-unit.source: Instead of hard-coding the repository URL, you can add a parameter for the repository URL and use that value for the **RepoUrl** property.
trans-unit.target: Instead of hard-coding the repository URL, you can add a parameter for the repository URL and use that value for the **RepoUrl** property.

trans-unit.source: You can see an example of repository URL parameter in the
trans-unit.target: You can see an example of repository URL parameter in the

trans-unit.source: [Web App with Web Jobs template](../app-service-web-deploy-web-app-with-webjobs.md).
trans-unit.target: [Web App with Web Jobs template](../app-service-web-deploy-web-app-with-webjobs.md).

trans-unit.target: Commands to run deployment

trans-unit.target: PowerShell

trans-unit.target: Azure CLI
